text: A SLOW DRIFT through a collection of crudely constructed, surreal, six-foot tall "IDOLS."  Like modern demons.  Grotesque.  Disturbing. WE LAP DISSOLVE between details o their twisted anatomies:  headlamp eyes, bright metal cla broken glass teeth.

Two vehicles, one a Volkswagen "bus" decorated with styli flames, the other a '66 Thunderbird, speeding along a ser of eerily empty desert roads, somewhere in a wilderness o sand and heat. END CREDITS.

A violent WIND HOWLS around, but through the sand we-can make out a large, ominous building:  the HOUSE of William Nix.  Its walls are white-washed and scrawled with GRAFFI The "family" of IDOLS surrounds the doorway, guarding it. SCREEN, the words:  '"Nevada - Thirteen Years Ago"

We're at the front door now, which stands open.  Leaning against the door-frame is a scrawny, wild-eyed YOUTH, abo sixteen.  His name is BUTTERFIELD.  He's got a brooding, almost sultry look on his face.  One of his eyes is black the other milky blue.  He's whittling something with a scalpel. Distantly, the sound of CAR ENGINES.  Butterfiel narrows his eyes. BUTTERFIELD'S P.O.V. The Volkswagen "bus" and Thunderbird are approaching the house.
(softly)
Swann...? He turns from the door.  In his haste he drops the WOOD h whittling.  He's been carving a DEATH'S HEAD.

The house no longer serves any domestic function.  It has become the temple and dormitory of Nix's small apocalypti cult.  As we go through the house with Butterfield we gli a little of what life here is like.  The rooms are murky, and chaotic.  The walls, PAINTED wit scenes of cities and landscapes BURNING, and creatures fr some unspeakable nightmare ATTACKING, RAPING, and DEVOURI helpless humanity.  The atmosphere is joyless, and oppressive.  The passages become progressively darker as the boy makes way to the heart of the house.  Only OIL LAMPS, set on th floor, light these claustrophobic corridors.
Master?

A dozen CULTISTS sit cross-legged on the floor in front o their leader, WILLIAM NIX.  His black hair grows to his shoulders.  His eyes are deep and glittering, his voice seductive.  A terrifying yet charismatic presence.  All the Cultists - who are a cross-section of obsessives wear the same simple T-shirts, painted with the cult's SI They watch Nix in adoration.  As Nix speaks, he juggles a FLAME, passing it from hand t hand with casual ease...
And the fire said to me:  Nix, Nix, you're my instrument. From now on, you'll be called the Puritan...
(murmuring)
Puritan... NIX You will find a few good men and women, and together, together you will cleanse the world.
Yes... Butterfield enters.
Master? Nix looks up.
Swann's here.  Nix rises, smiling.
(to Cultists)
We'll come back to this. Get about your business.  As the Cultists disperse, Nix and Butterfield exit into

A place of nightmares. Hanging from the middle of the cei is another grotesque SCULPTURE, three times the bulk of a large man, and made of metal, fly-blown animal parts and knotted rope.  It is vaguely cruciform, but its swaying, creaking bulk is not even faintly Christian.  It is a perverse, sickening image, evoking insanity and agony. From the shadows in the corner, we hear a young girl's so SOBBING.

Hush... Nix goes to the GIRL.  She is twelve; beautiful, blonde, presently in a state of mortal fear.  She sits, bound, in fetal position, her face soaked with SWEAT and TEARS, her mouth BLOODIED, her cheek BRUISED.
I said hush.
Please.  Let me go. From the opposite corner the SCREECH of Nix's pet BABOON. Nix goes to it.  The animal is large and lethal.
(to Baboon)
What is it? The Baboon pulls on its chain, staring at the Girl and ba its teeth as it screeches.
(to Girl)
I think he's in love. He unshackles the Baboon.  The animal pads toward the Gir trailing its chain.
Keep it away from me. Nix catches hold of its chain.  Holds it back.  The Baboo starts screeching again, scrabbling at the Girl, its NAIL catching her arms and legs, drawing BLOOD.
Please... please... Nix watches her terror dispassionately.
(also watching, wide-
eyed) Want me to shoot Swann?
You don't like him, do you?
He wants your magic.
Maybe.  Go fetch him. Butterfield exits.  Nix advances on the Girl.
What are you going to do?

The two vehicles come to a halt outside Nix's house. From the Thunderbird steps PHILIP SWANN, a nineteen- year with shoulder-length hair and brilliant blue eyes.  He's conventionally handsome, but he's certainly striking.  From the passenger seat steps CASPAR QUAID, a black man, studious and intense.  From the bus emerges MURRAY PIMM, skinny and jittery, and JENNIFER DESIDERIO, a woman with steely gaze.
(to all three)
Are we ready?
(cool)
Say the word.
(very nervous)
Look, maybe we should think this over. On Swann, as he brings from his car three very bizarre pi of METALWORK.  We get only a tantalizing glimpse of them, he slips them into his pocket.
No.  He's gone too far.
So he took a child.
He'll kill her.
No he won't.
(determined)
He's not going to get the chance. Quaid checks a gun, then slips it into his belt.
If he gets in our fucking heads he'll drive us crazy.
So stay out here. Swann starts towards the House.  Jennifer is the first to follow, with the other two on her heels.
Butterfield comes to the door, as Swann steps inside.
He's expecting you. Behind Swann, Quaid and Pimm exchange nervous looks.
(to others)
Look around.  If you find 'the child, yell.  She's got blonde hair, that's all I know. Butterfield turns away, smiling to himself.  Swann follow him.
Quaid looks into a large circular room where FIVE CULTIST (three men and two women) still sit.  One of the women is breast-feeding a baby.
Hey, Quaid.  I thought you said you weren't coming back.
I changed my mind.

Come and join us. She smiles a crazy smile.  Reaches out for Quaid.  A SNAK appears from around the back of her neck.  Quaid recoils. And now we see that there are snakes everywhere.  In the Cultists' clothes and hair.  Even on the baby.  Quaid tur away.  And - shock! - there's a SNAKE on the door frame, winding around his hand.  He strikes it to the ground, an drives his heel down on its head.
(angry)
Don't do that! The Snake-Handler gets up.  Quaid retreats from the door. Snake-Handler picks up the dead snake and, lifting it abo his head, dribbles its BLOOD onto his face.
Jennifer enters a gloomy room.  She goes to a mattress wh a BLONDE GIRL lies with her bare back to us.
Don't be afraid. The Blonde Girl, BARBARA, turns over.  She has a dirty cl pressed to a wound between her breasts.  It is not the Gi of course.  She stares up at Jennifer, clearly drugged.
I'm not... want to see? She pulls the cloth away.  She has carved the cult SIGIL her FLESH.  The BLOODY KNIFE lies beside her. Jennifer retreats to the door, and exits back out into --
Pimm is standing against the wall, clutching a CRUCIFIX. is ashen with terror.  Jennifer snatches the crucifix fro his white-knuckled fingers.
He's going to kill us all...
Where did Swann go? Pimm points down the passageway towards Nix's room.
Swann wipes sweat from his upper lip, then reaches down t his belt, to check the GUN tucked out of sight at his sid He turns the door handle.

Swann steps inside.  Nix's chair has its back to him. The folds of Nix's robe are visible, however.  Swann hears a muffled SOBBING from the far side of the room.  On the Girl, now gagged and lying amongst bones and filth Swann starts towards her, his footsteps barely audible. he approaches the chair - the Baboon leaps at him screech He reaches for his gun.  The chair topples.  The Baboon, dressed in Nix's robes, bounds towards Swann.  Swann FIRES at it.  The bullet blasts off half its head.
On Quaid, who draws his GUN as three CULTISTS appear in t passageway that leads to Nix's Sanctum.
Stay the fuck away! (yells)
Pimm!  Get over here!
PAN UP from the twitching Baboon corpse to Swann as he struggles with the Girl's gag.  He has laid his gun on th ground beside her.

You're going to be okay. Out of focus, behind him, the cruciform sculpture swings round.  Nix is hanging on it, like an idol on a grotesque altarpiece.  The Girl sees Nix over Swann's shoulder.  Terror crosses face.  Swann turns.
I knew you'd come.  He reaches down to Swann.
I've got so much power to give you, Swann.  All you have to do is...beg.
Fuck you.
You don't think I've got it to give?
No! Suddenly. Nix swoops down on Swann. apparently defying gravity.
You're wrong. He catches hold of Swann with one hand and drives him bac against the wall.
I could eat your fucking soul, Swann.
Jennifer, reaches the door of the Sanctum.  Butterfield s from the shadows.  His KNIFE flashes as it strikes Jennif hand.  BLOOD SPURTS.
Fuck! She retreats, staunching her bleeding hand.
Nix has Swann trapped against the wall and is working his fingers against Swann's temples.  Working, working, like psychic surgeon plying against the belly of a patient.

You want to know what the world really looks like? Swann struggles, but he can't get free of Nix's hold.  And now -- horribly -- Nix's fingers slide beneath the sk of Swann's temples, without a drop of blood being spilt.
Want to see flesh with a god's eyes? Swann SCREAMS as Nix's mind-hold seizes him.
Quaid levels his gun at Butterfield, who is guarding the Sanctum door.  Jennifer is at Quaid's side.
Aah!

Get away from the door! Butterfield shakes his head.  Quaid FIRES.  The bullet. strikes the wall beside Butterfield's head.  He retreats, growling like a rabid animal.  Quaid kicks the Sanctum do open, and enters.
Swann?
(to Quaid)
Here he is. Swann stumbles into the middle of the room, the whites of eyes blood-red.
Take a look, Swann!  These are your friends. On Swann, reeling like a drunkard as he looks up at Quaid Jennifer.

What have you done to him?  SWANN'S P.O.V. of Quaid and Jennifer.  To Swann's eyes, their faces seem be MORPHING.  Their humanity is MELTING AWAY. What's left like a jellyfish with black, soulless eyes:  PRIMEVAL MUC
Swann.  It's okay. Quaid reaches for Swann, who retreats in horror, shaking head violently.
Don't touch me.  He's got... got into my head.
You want to be like that, Swann?  Mud and shit? Swann turns away from Quaid and Jennifer in disgust.
of Nix, his arms outstretched in welcome.  His face has a aura of pulsing light.

Come here.  Share the power. ON a GUN, leveled. .We don't see by whom.  The trigger is pulled.  The bullet strikes Nix's back and explodes out of his che ON SWANN, staring at Nix.  SWANN'S P.O.V. of Nix, as the aura of light dies.  Just for a moment - a terrible moment - Swann glimpses something else. MORPHING out of Nix's features.  A NIGHTM FACE with waves of DARKNESS emanating from the middle of forehead.  Swann covers his eyes.
(raging, terrifying)
Swann!  Swann! Nix staggers, letting out an ungodly HOWL, and drops to h knees, clutching the WOUND.  As he falls, he reveals the ashen Girl, who is still holding Swann's smoking GUN.
(a roar)
Help me! Swann shakes his head, ridding himself of Nix's mind- control.
Jesus-
Pinon stands guard, his gun pointed on several cultists.
(with distressing
confidence) You can't kill him.
He'll just rise up again!
On Nix, doing just that:  rising up.  Right hand clamped his bloody chest, left hand reaching for Swann.
Help me! Quaid FIRES at him again. Strikes his shoulder.  And agai Strikes his leg.  Nix collapses to the ground,
Quickly! They have come prepared for this.  Swann now takes from h jacket the three strange pieces of METALWORK.  There are SCREWS in then all.
(seeing)
Swann?  What are you doing?

Binding you. He clamps one of the pieces over Nix's EYES.  It fits lik eyeless mask.  Nix thrashes and SCREAMS.  Swann lays his hands on the side of the mask, and  LIKE MAGIC -- his tou makes the screws tighten of their own accord, grinding in Nix's flesh and bone with a gut- wrenching SOUND.  BLOOD from the screw-holes.
Fuck you, Swann!  Fuck you! Now the second piece, over his MOUTH.

Sw He's silenced.  The piece screws itself into-his head, li the first.  And now comes the third and final piece:  ove the nose and into the ears.  Again, it screws itself into place.  Swann has done all he can.  He retreats from Nix's body, it continues to convulse.  We go from face to ashen face, each man and woman watches and waits.  Why won't he die?  And now, at last  the violence of Nix's death-throes diminishes.  Nix's body bends like a bow, arching off the ground, and with one last, terrible spasm, he dies.
(quietly)
Is it finished?
It's finished.
The Cultists' faces slacken, as though some mental hold N had upon them has disappeared.  Then they start to retrea their confidence and courage gone.  Pimm steps into the Sanctum.
The five assassins, including the Girl, stand around Nix' body.  Swann has his arm around the Girl.
Dead?
Dead.
What now?
We bury him so deep no one will ever find him.

The wind has died away.  It's eerily calm.  Butterfield dashes towards camera, then halts.  HE LOOKS BACK, as Nix's killers load his huge, limp CORPS into the back of Murray Pimm's bus.  ON Butterfield.  He watches, with a feral look on his fac

The city looks magical in the spring light, its palms and gleaming towers, its rivers of sun-baked traffic, evoking some fantastical metropolis.  This, for all its smog and congestion, is a city of exoticism and enchantments. ON SCREEN, the words:  "LOS ANGELES - THIRTEEN YEARS LATE
The facade of this small HOTEL off Hollywood Boulevard ne a lick of paint, and the neon sign is blinking fitfully, it has a certain charm.

A large deteriorating mural of Hollywoodland, depicting a host of 50's movie stars, dominates the lobby.  At the front desk - with his back to us at present - stan HARRY D'AMOUR.  He is having difficulty getting the prett but vacant BLONDE at the reception desk to comprehend his name.
How'd you spell that again?
D.A.M.O.U.R.  D'Amour.  Harry D'Amour.
D'Amour.
Right.
Isn't that French for something? ON THE BELLBOY, approaching Harry from the front door.
Mister D'Amour?
(to Blonde)
Yeah.  It's French.
For love, right?
Mister D'Amour?
(to Blonde)
Right.
(grinning)
That's so cool.
Mister D'Amour? Harry turns.  He's wearing a washed-out Grateful Dead t- shirt, an Italian cut linen suit, and glasses.  He's handsome, unshaven, 35-ish, with an open easy smile.
Yeah?
You haven't paid the cab.  He won't give us your bags 'til you pay him.
How much?
Thirty-five bucks.
Tell him he can keep them. The Bellboy looks puzzled.
Just kidding. Harry gets out his wallet and hands over four ten-dollar bills.
I've got my life in there.

On the suit-case, which is now on the bed.  Harry flings open.  Inside, mingled with the clothes, a bizarre collec of items, which he tosses out onto the coverlet.  A GUN. CRUCIFIX.  A STATUE of Shiva, the Hindu Lord of creation destruction.  ON HARRY, as he heads into the bathroom.  Turns on the shower.  Starts to undress.
Harry, his hair still wet from his shower, steps out into sun.  Squints.  Puts on sunglasses.
Hello, L.A.
Have a nice evening, Mr. D'Amour.
You bet.

Harry stands, in a shabby doorway across the street from classy restaurant.  It's RAINING. ON TAPERT, a middle-aged, balding man with a very pretty WOMAN opposite him, sitting at a table close to the windo Tapert makes a joke (unheard).  The woman laughs.  ON HARRY, chewing on a hamburger, as he speaks into his t recorder.
Nine-eighteen p.m.  Tapert's either got a great sense of humour or he's paying her to laugh. (looks at hamburger in
disgust) Jesus. On Tapert, as he rises from the table.
(into tape recorder)
He's finished. Tapert exits the restaurant, and crosses the street. Harr tosses his half-eaten hamburger away, and goes to his car
Harry pulls the parking ticket off the windshield, screws up and gets in.
(into tape)
Nine twenty-six p.m.  He's off again. He turns the key in the ignition.

In neon blue and purple, a sign blazes in a store window. reads:  TAROT CARD AND CRYSTAL READINGS - $15 SPECIAL ON TAPERT, as he hurries across the street, and through t door beside the store window.  WE PAN OFF the door as Harry's car comes to a halt on the side of the street.  Harry gets out of the car.  Stares at the sign in the win puzzled.
Superstitious? He starts across the street.  Suddenly:

Oh my God! Tapert emerges, his face white with terror.  He stumbles his car, and he's away.  Harry freezes, caught between th need to follow Tapert and sheer curiosity. He gives in to latter, and steps inside.

An illuminated ARROW points up the stairs.  Harry ascends past faded PHOTOGRAPHS of Caspar Quaid with famous faces. At the landing, the passageway turns ninety degrees. Harr halts, and takes out his GUN.  There's a strange RUMBLING SOUND approaching from round t corner.  Harry chances a look.  There's a short length of passageway, leading to an open door.  From the threshold CRYSTAL BALL rolls towards Harry, BLOOD- SMEARED.  This i the source of the rumbling.  Harry stops the ball before falls down the stairs.  Dead silence.  After a beat, Harry creeps towards the ope door.  He pushes it open.  Inside, chaos.  The fake antiq FURNITURE is splintered, the ASTRAL CHARTS slashed.

There are two offices.  In the front, a Waiting Room, int which Harry now steps.  Beyond it, through a door that st narrowly ajar, the Fortune Telling Room.  From out of the Fortune Telling Room, a MOAN.

Ahh. . . Harry crosses the Waiting Room, reaching into his jacket his gun.  Suddenly, a nightmarish FIGURE leaps from the shadows.  His name is RAY MILLER.  He's as crazy as a rabid dog, te sharpened, eyes wild.  Nix's SIGIL is tattooed on the mid of his forehead.  He STRIKES the GUN from Harry's hand an goes for his throat.  Harry reaches out behind him, picks up a phrenologist's B and SMASHES it on Miller's skull.  Miller reels back.  Harry makes a dash for the door to th Fortune Telling Room.
Fuckhead.

A mysterious, candle-lit space.  In the middle of the roo table.  At it sits Quaid. thirteen years older. He has be tortured close to death.  Several small SCALPELS protrude from his chest and neck.  His life is ebbing away.  On th table in front of him, a fan of TAROT CARDS, BLOOD-SPATTE Harry races in through the open door from the Waiting Roo
What the fuck!? Harry picks up the PHONE.  It's dead.  Miller charges at door.

Shit! Harry SLAMS the door in Miller's face, and locks it.  As he does so, the candles FLICKER.  Harry looks up.  A FIGURE looms from the darkness behind Quaid.  He's in his late twenties:  an androgynous, disturbing sight. His lon hair is drawn back into a pony-tail.  His mismatched eyes one black, one milky blue, tell us that he is Butterfield His hands are BLOODY, and he carries one last SCALPEL.
(to Butterfield)
Don't touch him." Butterfield strokes the wounds on Quaid's cheek.  Quaid s in pain.

What are you going to do about it?  Miller's hand tears at the wood around the lock from the other side.  His fingers appear, scrabbling to tear the l out.  Harry doesn't move, or Miller will be through.
(to Harry)
Ever watched a man die?  If you watch very closely, you can sometimes see the soul escaping.  And if you're very quick, you can catch it.
Please... Butterfield... I wasn't there.  Ask Pimm.

Pimm's dead.  Jennifer Desiderio's disappeared.  They knew the Puritan was coming home.  As this exchange goes on, Miller pulls the lock out of th door and starts to THROW HIMSELF against it from the othe side.  It's all Harry can do to keep himself from being pitched across the room.  He looks around for some means defense.  There's a crack in the drapes to the left of th table.  Behind it a WINDOW.
So do you.  You've seen the future.  Haven't you?
Yes.
And are you afraid?

Yes. Suddenly, Harry steps aside.  The door's flung open. Mill CHARGES in.  Harry catches hold of his arm, and THROWS hi against the drape.  The window CRACKS; the drape comes do around Miller.  Amber STREETLIGHT floods in.  Butterfield is momentarily distracted.  Harry STRIKES the scalpel from his hands.  Miller, meanwhile, is struggling to free himself from the folds of the drapes.  Harry lands a solid KICK to the man belly.  Miller is THROWN back against the cracked window, which SHATTERS.  Still wrapped in the drape, he FALLS OUT Harry turns back to arrest Butterfield, but he's already making his escape.  Harry starts after him.
(to Harry)
Don't leave me. He turns back.  TEARS are pouring down the man's face. Ha goes back to comfort Quaid, as Butterfield escapes down t stairs.
You need an ambulance.
(in pain)
Too late.  Why are you here? Did you cone... up here for a reading?  Quaid takes hold of Harry's hand.
Quaid stares at Harry's HAND.  Fascinated, he momentarily forgets his pain.  He traces the lines with bloody finger
(quietly)
My God.
What?
You've taken some strange journeys in your life.
Yeah.  You could say that.
You're drawn to the dark side, over and over.  And it's drawn to you. (looks at Harry)
You don't like that.
Not much.
You can't change it.  You have to walk... (coughs)
...walk the line between Heaven and Hell.  It's your destiny.  Accept it. Harry takes his hand from Quaid's grip.  Quaid winces in pain.
Hold on.
I'm not afraid to die.  There's something terrible... coming home...
The Puritan?
Yes...
Who is he?  Quaid shudders, and dies.
(softly; sadly)

Shit. He looks away, down at the CARDS.  All have been turned o but ONE.  He turns it.  The card is the Ten of Swords whi pictures a prostrate man against a thunderous sky, pierce all ten swords.  An image of death and desolation.

The flashing LIGHTS of two patrol cars illuminate the sce DETECTIVE EDDISON, a surfer-turned-policeman with buzz-cu blond hair, heads along the alley with Harry.  He's midwa through taking Harry's statement. There are already two OFFICERS examining the drapes.  We can't yet see the body
(to Harry)
What were you doing up there?
I'm a private detective.  I was hired to follow somebody for a few days.  A guy called Tapert. Insurance fraud.
(writing)
Tapert.  So, now I've got Tapert, Butterfield.
Tapert's got nothing to do with this.  He came here to get his palm read.
What makes you so sure?
(shrugs)
I got a file on him two inches thick.  He's a petty fraudster. This is something else.  Ever heard of someone called the Puritan?
New one on me. (to Officer)
Okay.  Let's see him. OFFICER #l shakes his head, and opens up the drape. Broke GLASS drops from the folds, but that's all. Miller has go
Where the fuck is he?
He got up and walked.
(looking up at window)
After that fall?. He must have broken half his bones. WE MOVE IN ON HARRY, as he stares down at the drape.
I don't think he'd have given a shit.

The rooms are spartan.  Nothing on the walls.  Nothing on floors.  Very little furniture.  Butterfield sits beside the window, obsessively combing h long hair.  There is something feminine about him now:  h voice a whisper, his stare distracted.  If we didn't gues already, we're in the presence of a madman.  Miller is squatting against the wall, picking shards of G out of his torso.  It hurts, but he's enjoying himself.
D'Amour... D'Amour... Why do I know that name?
I know him.  I saw him. He stops to pull out a particularly large piece of glass, sighing with pleasure.
I saw him on T.V.  Some kid got possessed and he saved the little bastard's life.
He's a priest?
No.  He's just a guy who's got a nose for this shit. (a beat.  A smirk)
Like you. A long beat of silence.  Butterfield combs.  Miller digs glass.
I don't want him getting in the way.
He won't.  Another silence.
(dreamily)
We've all of us waited too long to have the homecoming spoiled.
What do you mean, "all of us?"
You didn't think it was just going to be you and me?  A lot of people believed in Nix. They haven't forgotten his promise.
About?
Death.
What about death?
(a beat)
It's an illusion.
On screen:  Philadelphia  A suburban street.  Early morning light.

CLOSE-UP of a PHOTOGRAPH of the Cultist with the Painted Face, from the opening scene, standing outside Nix's hous Nevada.  His name is Norman Sanders.  ON NORMAN, thirteen years older, looking down at the photograph.  He lays it down, beside a letter, on which t words are written: "Homecoming Time." Norman smiles to himself.  Goes to the wardrobe.  Gets ou small suitcase.  His WIFE'S BODY is slumped in the wardro glassy-eyed.  CLOSE UP of letter -

- and DRAW OUT from the letter to a different interior, a different domestic circumstance.  On the screen:  Miami.  BARBARA - the blonde girl who carved the cult's sigil int her chest - is washing her hands.  She casually dries the and picks up the letter, walking past her HUSBAND and SON both DEAD at the breakfast table, BLOOD spreading around their heads.  When she gets to the door she steps over th body of her DAUGHTER, who has also been shot trying to es her mother's murder spree.  ON THE RADIO, George Harrison sings "My Sweet Lord."
"I really want to see you, Lord, And it won't take long, my Lord, My sweet Lord..."
On screen:  San Antonio.  A ZOO-KEEPER wanders into the darkened interior of the Reptile House.

The Zoo-keeper's benign expression changes at the sight o the chaos inside.  The glass cases have been SMASHED. Ano KEEPER lies on the ground, his face pulped.  A few SNAKES slither around his body, but most of them have gone.
The Snake-Handler Cultist drives at speed.
PAN UP from another letter'- with the same message - on t dashboard, to the crazed face of the Snake-Handler. PAN T the back of the car.  IT SEETHES WITH HUNDREDS OF SNAKES.
It's early morning in Bel-Air.  The sun shines down on a millionaire's paradise:  a huge house surrounded by a jun of trees and blossoms.

The blue water glitters in the noon-day sun.  And a WOMAN her body perfectly proportioned -- glides under the surfa emerging at the shallow end, where the housekeeper CLEMEN is setting a tray on a table.
Coffee, Mrs. Swann? Mrs. Swann's name is DOROTHEA.  She is a beautiful and sensual woman.
Thank you.  She dries off.
Where's Mr. Swann?
In his study. (a beat)
He got something on his mind?
Why?
Bad mood today.

Venetian blinds shut out most of the sunlight, but a lamp burns on the desk (huge), showing us the furniture (leath the books (innumerable), and the figure of SWANN, sitting behind the desk smoking a CIGAR.  He's lost some hair and some colour over the years, but he still has the same hypnotic eyes. He studies the L.A. TIMES in front of him.

"Fortune Teller Brutally Murdered," the headline announce Underneath, a PHOTOGRAPH of Quaid's wrecked room.  WE CLO IN on the photograph, and catch a glimpse of Harry, stand looking at the chaos.  CAMERA. MOVES DOWN to the text beneath, and on to the name "Harry D'Amour."  ON SWANN, pensive as he studies the paper.
(softly)

Hey...  He looks up, startled. DOROTHEA The sun's shining out there. Dorothea is dressed a white robe now.  She literally brings light into this gloomy room.  On the shelves behind Swann are a number of brut figurines, vaguely recalling the idols outside Nix's "temple."
Bad show last night?
(wearily)
The usual.  Full house. Standing ovation.  I tell them it's magic...
(distastefully)
... they believe you.
Yeah. (a beat)
Remember Quaid?
Sure.
Somebody killed him.
Oh God.
(disturbed)
I just saw him. A difficult silence.  Then Swann crosses to the door.
I'm putting in a new illusion tonight.  Will you be there?
Sure.  You want me to find out about Quaid?  I mean, the funeral?
No. (superstitiously)

I don't want to think about it. If I think about it he'll hear me.  He'll find me.
Swann? Ahead now, the site where the workmen are digging a hole, laying pipes.  The CAMERA doesn't focus on this action, b we're aware of it.

I told you.  I don't -- She stops.  Looks ahead of her.  Her face is suddenly ash and clammy.  Harry follows her gaze to:  The hole.  Somebody is in it, digging.  Earth emerges in shovelfuls, piling up beside the hole.
(screaming)
God no!  Oh God no! She backs away from the hole.  The Nurse grabs hold of he
Calm down! She delivers the Nurse a backhand SWIPE.  The Nurse is fl back.
He's not going to get me! She races down towards the street.  Harry goes after her.
He's not!  He's not!
Who's not?  He catches up with her.
Nix! Nix!
Is he the Puritan?
Yes! Yes!
And he's dead?
No.  He's coming back.  He's digging his way out! The Nurse appears behind Harry.
I'll take care of her now. Jennifer struggles in Harry's grip.
Let go of her, Mr. D'Amour! The Nurse breaks Harry's hold on Jennifer, who slips away instantly, racing towards the street.

Jennifer! She scrambles up over a wall, and flings herself from the top.  There's a SCREECH of brakes, then the smashing of metalwork and glass.  Harry gets to the wall before the Nurse.  Hoists himself up onto it.  Looks down.
Jennifer is dead in the middle of the street, beneath the wheels of a car.  The DRIVER is out, and yelling incoherently.

Jesus. He slips back down the wall, and leans against it. He looks towards the hole.  The Workman has stopped diggi His mud-encrusted hands emerge, and for a moment, before head appears, the image is eerily like somebody climbing a grave.  Harry closes his eyes.
(very quietly)
Jesus.
The sun is setting, the city giving way to night.
Harry's on the phone.
I want to speak to Dorothea.
I'm afraid she's not in.
When will she be in?
Valentin on the phone in the study.
Who is it? Valentin puts the phone down.
Crank call.  I'll get the number changed.
No word from D'Amour?                             Valentin shakes his head.
It's better he's gone.  He would have done more harm than good.
Harm to whom?  Me?  I don't think, so.  Try him again at the hotel.
I left three messages already. Dorothea nods, plainly sad at Harry's desertion.  She tur and leaves the room.
ON BILLY WHO'S CARD, in Harry's hand.
(on phone)
Billy?  It's Harry.  Suppose I wanted to get into the repository at the Magic Castle?

text: You've done this before.
I've had my moments.
Harry's manipulating the lock.
I'm sure they'll have this place rigged.
How?
It'll be something hokey.  CLICK! The door opens.
Houdini'd been proud of you.
Undusted shelves piled high with manuscripts, old books, posters in every direction.
(impressed)

Whoa... On the wall, plaster LIFE-MASKS.  In glass cases, the too of the great magicians:  KNIVES, KEYS, GUNS, WANDS, even IRON MAIDEN.  Billy is in awe.  He wanders around wide-ey while Harry scans the shelves. The dialogue runs as they investigate.
I hear Mrs. Swann's quite a babe.
You heard right.
You ever been married?
Yeah.  She was killed in a car crash.  Her lawyer was driving. She was filing for divorce.
Why?
My life was too weird for her.
(grinning)
I love weird. Harry has seen a small SIGIL carved onto one of the shelv
Billy?  This was on Miller's forehead.  Any idea what it is?
Nope. Harry presses it.  The entire bookcase opens up, CREAKING
What did I tell you?  So fucking hokey. Inside, there is a small shelf.  On it, FILES and PAPERS.

What have we got here? Ever-eager, Billy steps into the recess.  And --  two spiked, latticed gates close on his arm!  Harry grabs the gates before they snap closed, inches fro skewering Billy's flesh and bone!  He keeps them open, hi sinews straining.
Grab the files! Billy reaches in and pulls out a handful of the files. As steps out of range. Harry lets go and the gates close wit
Jesus! He slams the files down.  He's trembling.
I could have lost my fucking hands.
That would have kept you out of the Magic Circle. (he studies the files)
Which was presumably the idea. (a beat)
These are about Nix. Harry takes a sheaf of papers, and hands them to Billy.

You go through these.  Go on! Reluctantly, Billy does so.  Harry picks up a faded PHOTOGRAPH of the doorway to Nix's HOUSE (with the sigil painted on it) and BUTTERFIELD the child standing in the There are other CULTISTS standing around.  And in the DOO -- a barely visible figure (and all the more intimidating that) - is NIX.
Wait a minute... He stares at the boy's face.  The eyes are clearly differ colours.
That's Butterfield...
(points to nan in)
doorway) And who's that? ON HARRY, staring at the ambiguous presence.  ON THE PHOTOGRAPH of the shadowy figure.
At a guess?  The Puritan.  Nix. Billy picks up an ETCHING, water-stained and dirty.  It s a horror we recognize:  a man's HAND pressed into the FLE of another man's HEAD.
Take a look at this.
(looking at it)

A Nix specialty? Billy is getting subtly spooked now.  He puts the etching down and starts to go through others in the series.  We glimpse them as he does so.  In one, a MAN regurgitates a serpentine form made of FLAME.  In another, a MAN stares his own HAND which is STRIPPED OF FLESH.  There is no bon beneath.  Only a form of solid blackness.  In a third, we a HEAD with a slit in the middle of the brow, emanating DARKNESS.
I don't know any of these tricks... Harry studies the etchings.
(a slow burn)
Maybe they're not tricks.
(mystified)
I mean, there's no instructions-- (realizes what Harry said)
What do you mean, they're not tricks?
What did Vinovich say? Something about walking a path between --
Trickery and divinity.  Yeah, he says that all the time.
That's because he knew.  He'd seen these files and knew.

Knew what? Out of the corner of his eye. Harry sees a motion between book-stacks.  Billy frowns.  Harry puts his fingers to hi lips.  Gestures for Billy to take cover. Billy backs away Harry slowly turns in the direction of the motion.  Something eerily sepulchral is gliding between the stacks figure in a straight-jacket with his head bowed. Harry takes out his gun.  Billy disappears around the back of one of the stacks. Ha goes after the apparition.  The TRACK is completely silent.  Suddenly, the creature appears behind Billy!  It looks up its face that of a psychotic:  burning eyes, manic smile. It tears open its straight-jacket and reaches for Billy, backs away.
Harry! Books tumble on top of Billy as he stumbles against the shelves.
Where the fuck are you? Harry appears, and puts his gun to the PSYCHO'S head.
Okay.  Hold it right there. The gun goes through the Psycho's skull, as though it's m of smoke.  Harry waves his hands through it.  It's completely ethere But it's still terrorizing Billy.
(in mortal terror)
Get it off me! Harry glances around.  Sees a LIGHT flickering between so books.  FIRES at it.  The light goes out.  The "Psycho" vanishes.  Billy is left hyper-ventilating on the ground.
Hokey enough for you?
I'm out of here, man!  Are you coming? Harry picks up a handful of papers from the Nix file.

I'm coming. Billy is already out of the room.  For a moment. Harry pa to look back at the other files, sealed behind the spiked gates.  As he does so -- -- the proiector sparks into life one last time, and the "Psycho" appears --ROARING - at Harry's shoulder.
Ah, shaddup! He FIRES at the projector a second time. On the GUN SHOT --
Billy and Harry are parting.
Thanks, Billy.
Hey, anytime. (a beat)
Actually, no.  This was enough.  They shake, and part.
Harry waits on the doorstep.  Valentin opens the door.
(quietly)
I can't let you in.
(stepping in)
Yeah, I know.
You want more money, is that it? Harry pushes him aside.
Harry starts to go through the house, opening doors.
Dorothea? He sees candle-light through a partially open door. Start towards it.
Leave her alone --
Shut up! He pushes open the door.

The room is a museum of Swarm's career.  Posters, and memorabilia everywhere.  And in the middle of the room, Swann's sealed CASKET, surrounded by flowers and candles. Dorothea is standing beside it, head bowed.
This is the way he wanted it... no autopsy, no embalming. Nobody meddling with his body... Harry approaches, slowly.
Flesh is a trap.  That's what he used to say.  Flesh is a trap and magic sets us free. (a beat)
Why did you come back?
I didn't leave.  I was just digging around. Dorothea looks up at him.
(uneasy)
What did you find?
Jennifer Desiderio, for one. (he watches her for a
response) She threw herself in front of a car this afternoon. Dorothea can't disguise her distress.
Oh Christ.
(a beat)
Why don't you tell me the truth?
Dorothea pours herself a drink, while Harry spreads the PHOTOS and the PAPERS from the repository on the table.
Nix ran some kind of cult, right?  Some kind of Charlie Manson deal?
It was more than that, I think.
He was the real thing, right?
Swann said he could do stuff, yes.
Stuff?
He could get into people's heads.  Make them see things. Terrible things.  And he could levitate.  Juggle fire.
He taught all this to Swann?
Some or it.
Valentin is listening at the door.
So Swann was performing magic. not illusions? (Dorothea nods)
And what?  You thought he should be using it to cure cancer, not making millions.
I told you --
Too much fame.  Yeah, I guess that'd turn anybody's head. Including yours.
No.
You said you weren't with him for love.
I wasn't.
What then?
I was grateful to him.  I owed him my life.  And he loved me. He couldn't always show it, but he felt it.

He thought Nix was coming back, didn't he? Dorothea is pouring herself another drink.  The glass sli from her hand.  It SHATTERS.  Harry goes to help her.  Th stoop together, very close.  The sexual attraction is alm palpable. Dorothea cuts herself on a shard of glass.
Shit! They are very close to each other.
(reassuring)
It's okay.
No it isn't.  You can't help me.
(tenderly)
I'm here, aren't I? He kisses her.  She kisses him back, hard.
Nothing's going to happen to you.
(seductive)
Nothing?
(smiles)
Nothing you don't want.  They kiss again, passionately.
Valentin breaks into the shadows, as Harry and Dorothea c the darkened lobby and head upstairs.  Then Valentin cros to the phone and dials.

A room of illusions.  Walls lined with mirrors, and warm, flattering lighting, bathing the naked forms of Dorothea Harry as they make love, sitting on the floor. It is a deeply passionate, but slow, sensual coupling.
Valentin opens the front door.  There's a wind blowing. T palms churn against the night sky...
Roiling, wind-filled pains with the glistening, urgent bo of Harry and Dorothea.
Harry cradles Dorothea in post-coital languor.
(whispers)
I was so afraid.
Don't be.  Nix can't hurt you now.
Are you sure?
I'm sure. (kisses her)
He's dead.
I know.  I'm the one who shot him. ON HARRY. He's startled, to say the least.
I was twelve.  Nix took me hostage, to get Swann to come to him.
(realizing)
And they all came...
Yes.
Quaid and Jennifer--
And Pimm and Swann.  Only Nix was ready for them. There's a NOISE downstairs.
(nervous)
What was that?
It's okay.  Harry slips out of bed.
Harry descends the stairs, buttoning up his trousers (whi is all he wears).  He has his gun.
Valentin?  Dorothea appears behind him.
Harry?  Wait! Harry's at the bottom of the stairs now.  Across the hall a passageway, an eerie SILHOUETTE.  We can make out no de of clothing or face.
What the hell-? Suddenly, the shadowy FIGURE comes at Harry.  A BLAST of ENERGY bursts against Harry's face.  As it breaks against skin, we see (for three frames or so) a glimpse of Harry' skull.
(in pain)
Aah! Harry FIRES at the figure.  The shadows fold up around th Stranger like an origami puzzle.  He's gone.
It's him!  It's Nix! Harry goes out into the passageway.

Valentin!  Get some lights on! As if in reply to the command, a burst of vivid white FIR erupts behind Harry.  He swings round to see the Stranger "unfolding" out of the shadows again, defying physics and physiology to do so.  The FIRE is at his feet, like a ser writhing on the ground.  It comes at Harry.  Harry FIRES it, but it comes at him faster still, rising to burn Harr leg.  He retreats, the FIRE racing after him. He makes fo door, and flings it open.  He's in --

The FIRE follows him across the ground and STRIKES his ha Harry drops the GUN.  Looks up to see the Stranger in the doorway, arm raised to will the fire-serpent on.  But the he hesitates.  Harry glances round, and sees that the Stranger - whose face is still a dark smear - is staring the CASKET.
Somebody you know? Dorothea appears behind the Stranger.  Sees Harry, burned sweating, cornered against the casket.
Oh my God! The Stranger looks round.  Harry snatches up the GUN, supporting his burned hand with -his good hand.  Levels t gun at the Stranger.  The FIRE raises its head, like a co
Which goes first?  My face or your heart? The Stranger draws a deep breath.  The Fire-Serpent withe and dies.
Who in God's name are you? She reaches for the Stranger, who simply folds up again; into darkness.  The WIND blows through the house, masking exit.
Are you all right?

Find Valentin!  Find him!  Get him in here! Dorothea disappears.  Harry takes one of the candle-holde and jams it under the casket lid.  Wood splinters.  He st to force off the lid.  Valentin and Dorothea enter.

What are you doing?  This is sacrilege. He starts towards Harry.  Dorothea goes after him and cat hold of his arm.  Her expression is a mingling of fascina and dread, as Harry gets his fingers under the casket lid pulls.  Inside, Swann's corpse.
Are you satisfied now?
No. Harry holds Valentin back with one hand, and puts his fin into the corpse's mouth.
Harry?
It's all right.  It's not hurting... He now has four fingers in Swann's mouth and seizes hold his lower jaw.  It cracks --  -- and comes away in a little rain of plaster and latex.
...plaster doesn't bleed. He tosses the jaw to Valentin.
(to Dorothea)
It looks like you're not a widow after all.
Harry interrogates Valentin in a white fury, while Doroth binds Harry's hand.
You rigged the illusion to fail, right?
Yes.
You paid off the doctor.  You set up the fake body.  Yes?
Yes.
And then... because I was getting too close to something -- (at Dorothea)
--or someone, you called Swann
I tried to pay you off.
Was that Swann's idea?
No.  It was mine.  I didn't want any more bloodshed. That's why we went to all this trouble, so there'd be no one for Nix to come after.
Nix is dead and buried, for fuck's sake.
Haven't you seen enough to know that doesn't matter? ON HARRY.  He looks as though he's beginning to think may Nix's resurrection is plausible.
I want to see Swann face to face.
Why don't you leave this alone? Let everybody think it's over?
What about me?
Nix was never interested in you.  It was always Swann.  A beat.
(to Dorothea)
Maybe Valentin's right.  We should let it alone.  A BELL starts to TOLL-
(con't.)
He went to all that trouble to be dead.  Maybe we should let him stay that way. The TOLLING carries over into

WE CRANE DOWN from a high angle on a GRAVE, surrounded by MOURNERS.  The graveside service has just ended, and the Mourners are beginning to disperse.  Dorothea is there amongst them, of course.  So are several faces we recogni Vinovich, Wilder, Billy Who, Swann's Stage Manager, his Dancers, his Technicians.  There are also several members the PRESS, and thirty or fourty other Mourners, some of w to judge by their dress and manner, are also illusionists Harry stands some distance from the crowd, watching (hidd from the doorway of a mausoleum.  His eyes are on Dorothe she goes amongst the Mourners, receiving unheard words of condolesence.
The standee of Swann is being demolished by two WORKERS. are taking hammers to it, smashing it to pieces.

The stage is starkly lit with working lights, the auditor in darkness.  Swann's equipment - including the partially dismantled Dragon's head - is heaped on the stage.  Valentin wanders through the boxes to the place where Swa "died."  He stares down at the BLOOD on the stage.
THE 1st WORKER throws the cut-out head of Swann's standee down into the street.
Watch out! On the HEAD, as it strikes the sidewalk at somebody's fee We don't see who.
Harry catches sight of somebody close to the gates of the cemetery.  Dark glasses, a beard, an anonymous black suit Harry smiles slightly, and slips off between the mausoleu
The BLACK-COATED MOURNER gets into his car.  On Harry, as he gets into his.
Valentin hears something in the auditorium.  Looks up.
Who's there? He reaches into his jacket to draw a GUN. There's a NOISE He swings round.  Too late. Butterfield has a scalpel at his throat.  He kicks Valent to the ground.
(conversationally)

I've sometimes thought, if I'd had another profession, I would have been a surgeon. On Valentin, staring up in terror.  Valentin's P.O.V.- of Butterfield, upside down, above him the scalpel glittering.
To be able to heal with one little cut. On Valentin again, as Butterfield's blade touches his che just beneath his eye.
No. . .
Let's say those eyes of yours were giving you trouble.
Please.
I could scoop them out.
Don't.
So tell me where Nix is buried.
I don't know. Butterfield pushes the blade into Valentin's skin.  CUT WIDE, as Valentin thrashes, his face obscured by Butterfield's body.
Wait! On Valentin again.  There is a small cut beneath his eye, that's all.
I'll tell you.
You'll do more.than that.

A bad neighborhood, to judge by the state of the streets. Harry gets out of his car and crosses to a gate, topped w barbed wire.  He peers through the bars.  Harry's P.O.V. of the STRANGER from the funeral disappear into the building.  He glances back towards the street. get a glimpse of a bearded face beneath the brim of his h Harry slides out of sight.  Waits until the Stranger has inside.  Then he's up, over the gate, braving the barbed wire.

It's been a hospital.  Now the echoing corridors and ward are deserted, littered with reminders of old suffering.  Rotting mattresses; spilled boxes of surgical supplies.  Harry explores this tiled labyrinth, looking for some sig the Stranger.  He enters a shadowy room.  Birds fly UP into his face!  As he retreats, another SOUND, a little distance from him GUN in hand, he heads towards it, and steps into

Narrow shafts of light through the circular viewing windo fall on an operating table, and looming pieces of discard equipment.  Eerie.  Disturbing.  Harry scans the shadows as he advances into the room.
I knew you wouldn't be able tn stay away. Silence.  Harry notices the beard and glasses on the operating table.
You had to see who wept for you the most. Silence.
A lot of people are going to be really pissed off when they discover you're still alive.
They'll never find out.  Harry looks up. Svanrt is hovering in the air above him.  The veins in hi temples bulge and throb.  This trick requires a lot of concentration.
Look, Ma, no wires.
You shouldn't have followed me, D'Amour.
How the fuck do you do that?
Now I'm going to have to kill you.
I don't think so.  You need me alive.
Why?  So you can fuck my wife? Swann swoops down towards Harry, who levels his gun.
Be careful.  Funerals make me trigger-happy. Swann stops, inches from the ground.
You know, it's such a fucking waste.  You can do shit most of us can only dream about, and you go around pretending it's some trick.
Illusionists get. Las Vegas contracts, D'Amour.  Magicians get burned.
Or murdered, like Nix.
He deserved it.
Maybe he doesn't see it that way.  Maybe he's digging his way out of the hole you put him right now.  That's what you're hiding away from, isn't it?
I did it for Dorothea.
Oh yeah?
Now that I'm dead, the spotlight's off her. Harry grabs Swann, literally pulling him down to earth. N they're face to face.  Eye to eye.  Swann, for all his posturing, is afraid.
So Nix won't come looking for her?
It's me betrayed him.
And she shot him I  I think that'd piss me off if I were Nix.
(despairing)
I don't know what else to do.
Help me. On Swann, his face a churning mass of rage and fear.

Listen.  If he's back from the dead, then he is some kind of god.  And he'll find you, wherever the fuck you are.  And if he's just another phony Messiah, then you can stage the greatest come-back in history. ON Swann.  This doesn't sound like such a terrible idea.
A car comes to a halt outside the house, where six vehicl are already gathered.  The SNAKE-HANDLING Cultist gets ou SNAKES seethe out of the open car door.

We MOVE THROUGH the shadowy interior, catching sight of several CULTISTS as we go.  They all have looks of barely suppressed ecstasy on their faces.  We are moving towards the Sanctum, and it's getting darke A MATCH is struck, and an OIL-FLAME sputters into life. see NORMAN'S gleaming face. On the wall is a PICTURE of N floating over a scene of apocalyptic destruction.  Norman brushes away thirteen years' accrual of DIRT. Bene Nix's expression is as rabid and terrifying as ever.  Nor grins.
A small, garishly-lit liquor store.  Harry's car pulls in the lot.  Swann gets out, his disguise back on. Heads int the store.  Harry, agitated and impatient, follows him.
Swann is at the cashier's desk, with a bottle of cheap brandy.
Is this the best brandy you've got?
If that's what's on the shelves. Swann produces a thousand dollar bill out of thin air.
Can you change a thousand for me?
(amazed)
You're shittin' me.
Can we go? Swann starts to COUGH.  A QUARTER falls from his mouth.
Oh Jeez.
Will that do?  No? Swann coughs again.  Puts his hand to his mouth.  A DELUG QUARTERS runs between his fingers.
That better?  The Cashier gapes.
The house could not look more reassuringly calm.  A SWAN struts beside the pool.  A long, HUSHED MOMENT...

A BABOON SHRIEKS, its mouth filling the frame.  CUT WIDE, to reveal the Baboon, racing around Nix's Sanct crazed.  Hanging on the sculpture that swings from the roof is a shadowy figure.  Is it Nix?  We can't quite see.  Black B runs from the figure and splashes on the ground. NOW WE SEE DOROTHEA, being pulled by the Cultists towards falling gouts of dark fluid -- -- she struggles, SOBBING -- CUT TO:
She tosses around on the bed
-- Dorothea has a GUN in her hand.  The Cultists shake it from her grip, and pull her directly under the BLOOD -- a SPLASHES on her upturned face --
A SOUND. Dorothea wakes, distressed by the dream.  She ge up and goes out onto --
Looks down the stairs.
Who's there? Silence.  Then, Valentin speaks behind her.  She jumps.
I'm sorry. BLOOD runs from his cut face.
Jesus.  Valentin.  What did you do to your face?
It was me. She turns.  He's on her in a heartbeat, pressing her back against the wail.
Guess who we're going to see?
Harry drives.  Swann takes a throatful of brandy.  Then h stares at Harry.
You think I'm an asshole.
Didn't know you read minds.
(a warning)
I can do a lot of shit, D'Amour.  But you know that. (an apology)
So I like playing games with people.  Gives them something to wonder about...
Is that all?
I distract them from their banality for a few minutes. It's like a public service.  It doesn't mean much in the end. They're all going to die.
And you're not?  Silence for a moment.
Oh, I was going to discover the secret of the universe.  That's why I liked Nix.  He promised me all these explanations.
And he didn't have them?
He had something.  He showed me how to bend the rules.  A little levitation.  A few fireworks.
Is that all?
No. (a beat)
At the end... when we had him cornered, he got into my head. He showed me what we really look like, when the veneer's gone.  Jelly.  Shit...
And you believed him?
I saw it with my own fucking eyes!  See, that's his best trick.  No illusions.  Just the truth. (he looks at Harry)
Are you ready for that?  Harry grabs the brandy bottle from Swann.
Hey! Harry drinks.
Thought not.
PAN DOWN from the palms to Harry's car, outside the front door.
Harry puts his head in the study, the library, the bedroo
Dorothea? Now he's on the landing.  Swann's below.
She's not here. Harry spots Valentin's BLOOD on the carpet.
Did she know where Nix was buried?
No.
Who else did?  Did Valentin?
Yes.
Jesus!
Butterfield's SEDAN crosses the desert, under a sky full stars.

Valentin drives.  Butterfield and Dorothea are in the bac Dorothea is handcuffed.  He has a bag open at his feet.  One by one he takes out a series of extraordinary instruments.  Dorothea looks on, confounded.
Like the look of these?  I made them myself, to set him free.
Why did you wait so long?
I didn't have the skill to resurrect him.  I had to teach myself.  And that took time.
And you think he'll be in a fit state to resurrect, after thirteen years?
If he was just a man like me, then no.  But he's not.
What is he?
Maybe he'll show you. ON DOROTHEA, terror in her eyes.

Now there are a dozen vehicles parked around the house. Through the windows, the flickering of oil-lamp FLAMES. There is a low, ominous CHANT floating from the house. It has no words, but it is steadily BUILDING in intensity We DRIFT towards the front door.

Now we move down the passageway to the Meditation Room. Inside, SEVENTEEN CULTISTS kneel in a circle.  They are a CUTTING OFF THEIR HAIR, and throwing it into the FIRE tha blazes in the centre of the circle.  They hack indiscriminately, with KNIVES, SCISSORS and RAZORS, their eyes wild.  BLOOD runs down their faces and necks from ni ears and scalps. And still the CHANT BUILDS, and BUILDS...
He will come!  He will come! He will come!

Wide.  A few rocks, and emptiness.  The headlamps of Butterfield's sedan burn in the darkness illuminating the dig.  Valentin is in the grave, digging. ON Butterfield, as he stands at the edge of the hole, watching the work.  Dorothea stands a yard or two behind
Anything?
Not yet. Butterfield squats at the edge of the hole and suddenly reaches out for Valentin, hauling him close.
If you've lied to me to me --

I swear... this is the place Swann told me about.  The rocks... On Dorothea, who uses Butterfield's distraction to take a steps back towards the open car door.  Dorothea's P.O.V. of Butterfield, back to her, interrogat Valentin.
Five more minutes.  Hear me? And you'd better not -- A SOUND behind him.  Butterfield wheels round.  On the gr beside the open car door, the instruments.
What the fuck are you playing at? He goes to pick them up.  Dorothea steps from behind the door, with the sharpest in her hand.  She slashes at him. Opens a WOUND across his arm.
Aah! He comes at her suddenly, striking the instrument from he hand, and slamming her against the car.  He hits her.  On Twice.  Then --
Butterfield! Butterfield goes to the edge of the grave, picks up the flashlight and trains the beam on Valentin.
(blinded)
In the corner... The beam goes to the corner of the grave.  A mummified HAND is sticking out of one of the walls.
(to Valentin)

Keep away from it. Butterfield jumps down into the grave, and goes to the ha The TRACK is silent, but for Butterfield's shallow breath He reaches out to touch Nix^s fingers... Closer...  Closer...  He touches the hand - and the wall of sand comes down wit
He jumps back as Nix's corpse, his head still sealed by t mask rolls into view.
Oh Christ!  Oh Christ!
(reverentially)
It's him... it's him. On Dorothea, sliding down the car in despair.
The car is static; the engine still running.
